thread.title: Tech picks up commitment from five-star Frisco OL Jack Anderson
thread.title_full: Texas Tech picks up commitment from five-star Frisco OL Jack Anderson | Dallas Morning News

author: EJ Holland
title: Tech picks up commitment from five-star Frisco OL Jack Anderson
text:
It was a rough weekend for Texas Tech, but the Red Raiders made some major waves on the recruiting trail on Monday night.
Texas Tech reeled in one its highest rated commits in recent memory when five-star 2017 Frisco offensive lineman Jack Anderson decided to pull the trigger. Anderson announced his pledge via Twitter.
Some things never change... It's official! I'm a Red Raider! LUBBOCK TX...I'm coming! ðŸ”«ðŸ‘†ðŸ» TooTurntU! #SuperBoom ! pic.twitter.com/c5GAO6jVta
— Jack Anderson (@JackAnderson_53) October 6, 2015 Anderson committed to Texas Tech over offers from Alabama, Florida State, LSU, Texas, Texas A&M and a slew of other major programs.
At 6-foot-4, 285 pounds, Anderson is ranked as the No. 1 offensive guard in the nation and No. 5 overall prospect in the state, according to 247Sports Composite.
Anderson was a second team all-district selection as a sophomore. Frisco is currently 5-1 and coming off a win over Frisco Heritage.
Anderson is the third commit in Texas Tech's 2017 class.
